intro: Cochlidiosperma triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed glassywood, is a rare and endemic plant species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its woody structure and thick, fleshy leaves help it conserve water in harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cochlidiosperma triloba is considered a vulnerable species.
